content.processed:
Rules and recommendations

Graduations are not taking place at the moment. Governmental and ministerial measures set out general obligations concerning restrictions on free movement and the wearing of protective equipment, but the final decision on holding or canceling graduations falls under the specific university. These decisions are based on general measures and the epidemiological situation.

Diplomas will be awarded through the academic department. Alternative graduation dates will be organized according to the development of the epidemiological situation.

There are no matriculations (the matriculation pledge will be signed by the study department) or other academic ceremonies.

For more information on graduations and diplomas, see the faculty's website or contact the study department.

questions_answers.question: Who decides whether there will be a graduation?
How do I find out if the graduation is taking place?
questions_answers.value: Take a look at the faculty website or contact the academic department.

questions_answers.question: Will I get a diploma if there is no graduation?
questions_answers.value: Yes, diplomas can be issued by the academic department upon agreement.

questions_answers.question: Will there be alternative graduation dates?
questions_answers.value: It depends on the decision of the particular faculty with regard to the development of the epidemiological situation.
